metadata.title: NBA CBA Study Materials - Batch 1: Article VII - Salary Cap & BRI

questions.question: What type of salary cap does the NBA use?
questions.explanation: The NBA uses a soft salary cap system that allows teams to exceed the cap using specific exceptions.

questions.question: What is Basketball Related Income (BRI)?
questions.explanation: BRI is total revenue from basketball operations including tickets, broadcast, sponsorships, and merchandise.

questions.question: What percentage of BRI goes to players?
questions.explanation: Players receive approximately 50% of Basketball Related Income.

questions.question: What is the Salary Cap based on?
questions.explanation: The Salary Cap is calculated based on projected Basketball Related Income for the upcoming season.

questions.question: What is the Luxury Tax threshold?
options: Threshold above cap where teams pay tax
questions.explanation: The Luxury Tax threshold is set above the Salary Cap where teams pay tax on excess spending.

questions.question: What are the Aprons?
questions.explanation: First and Second Aprons are salary thresholds above luxury tax with escalating restrictions.

questions.question: What is minimum team salary?
questions.explanation: Teams must maintain at least 90% of the salary cap.

questions.question: What is the Larry Bird Exception?
options: Re-sign own players over cap after 3 years
questions.explanation: Larry Bird Exception allows teams to exceed cap to re-sign players with 3+ years on team.

questions.question: How many years for full Bird Rights?
questions.explanation: Player must be with team 3 consecutive years for full Bird Rights.

questions.question: What are Early Bird Rights?
questions.explanation: Early Bird Rights apply after 2 consecutive years with same team.

questions.question: What is Non-Taxpayer MLE?
questions.explanation: Non-Taxpayer MLE allows teams under tax to sign free agents for ~$12M.

questions.question: What is Taxpayer MLE?
questions.explanation: Taxpayer MLE is smaller (~$5M) for teams above luxury tax.

questions.question: What is Bi-Annual Exception?
questions.explanation: Bi-Annual Exception is ~$4M usable every other year.

questions.question: What is Room Exception?
questions.explanation: Room Exception is ~$7M for teams that use their cap space.

questions.question: What is Minimum Salary Exception?
questions.explanation: Teams can sign unlimited minimum salary players without cap impact.

questions.question: What happens above Second Apron?
questions.explanation: Teams above Second Apron face severe restrictions including frozen draft picks.

questions.question: Can Second Apron teams send cash in trades?
questions.explanation: Teams above Second Apron cannot send cash in trades.

questions.question: What is a trade exception?
options: Amount from trading more salary out than in
questions.explanation: Trade exception created when trading away more salary than received.

questions.question: How long does trade exception last?
questions.explanation: Trade exceptions expire one year from creation.

questions.question: What is a cap hold?
questions.explanation: Cap holds are placeholders for unsigned free agents counting against cap.

questions.question: How is cap hold calculated?
options: Percentage of prior salary by FA status
questions.explanation: Cap holds calculated as percentages of prior salary based on FA classification.

questions.question: Can teams remove cap holds?
questions.explanation: Teams can renounce player rights to remove cap holds.

questions.question: What is salary matching in trades?
questions.explanation: Teams over cap must match within specific percentage thresholds based on amounts.

questions.question: Do teams under cap match salaries?
options: No, can take any salary up to cap space
questions.explanation: Teams with cap room don't need to match salaries in trades.

questions.question: What is base year compensation?
options: Special calculation for extended players in trades
questions.explanation: BYC applies to recently extended players traded same league year.

questions.question: What triggers hard cap at First Apron?
options: Using Non-Taxpayer MLE, Bi-Annual, or sign-and-trade
questions.explanation: Using Non-Taxpayer MLE, Bi-Annual, or sign-and-trade triggers hard cap.

questions.question: Can hard-capped team exceed apron?
questions.explanation: Hard-capped teams absolutely cannot exceed apron for remainder of season.

questions.question: Does hard cap carry over?
questions.explanation: Hard cap resets each July 1.

questions.question: What is minimum salary for 0 years service?
questions.explanation: Minimum salaries set annually based on salary cap percentage.

questions.question: How does minimum increase with service?
questions.explanation: Minimum salary has tiered scale from 0 to 10+ years.

questions.question: Luxury tax rate for first $5M over?
questions.explanation: First $5M over tax threshold is $1.50 per dollar.

questions.question: What is repeater tax?
options: Higher rate for teams paying tax 3 of 4 years
questions.explanation: Repeater tax applies to teams paying luxury tax in 3 of previous 4 years.

questions.question: Where does luxury tax money go?
questions.explanation: Luxury tax revenue distributed to teams that didn't pay tax.

questions.question: Can First Apron teams use Bi-Annual?
questions.explanation: Teams above First Apron cannot use Bi-Annual Exception.

questions.question: Can First Apron teams use Non-Taxpayer MLE?
questions.explanation: First Apron teams limited to smaller Taxpayer MLE.

questions.question: What is sign-and-trade?
options: Re-sign own FA and trade immediately
questions.explanation: Sign-and-trade is re-signing own free agent then trading them.

questions.question: Can teams aggregate salaries?
questions.explanation: Teams can aggregate multiple outgoing salaries to match incoming.

questions.question: Can recent FAs be aggregated?
options: No, same league year FAs cannot aggregate
questions.explanation: Players signed same league year cannot be aggregated together.

questions.question: What is minimum roster charge?
options: Empty spots count as minimum salary
questions.explanation: Teams under 12 players have cap charges for empty spots.

questions.question: Can trade exceptions combine?
questions.explanation: Trade exceptions cannot be combined.

questions.question: What is disabled player exception?
questions.explanation: Disabled player exception allows replacement signing for season-ending injury.

questions.question: Max players on regular season roster?
questions.explanation: Teams can have maximum 15 players on standard contracts.

questions.question: Max two-way players?
questions.explanation: Teams can have up to 3 two-way contract players.

questions.question: Can teams use Bird Rights for draft picks?
questions.explanation: Teams can use Bird Rights to re-sign draft picks after rookie contract.

questions.question: 2023-24 salary cap approximately?
questions.explanation: 2023-24 salary cap was approximately $136 million.

questions.question: When is cap determined?
questions.explanation: Salary cap determined in early July based on projected BRI.

questions.question: Can cap decrease year to year?
questions.explanation: Cap can decrease if Basketball Related Income declines significantly.

questions.question: What's in player's cap hit?
questions.explanation: Cap hit includes base salary plus likely bonuses.

questions.question: What is cap smoothing?
questions.explanation: Cap smoothing prevents dramatic year-over-year cap increases.

questions.question: What is renegotiation?
questions.explanation: Renegotiation increases player's salary for current or upcoming season.
